intro: Meehania montis-koyae, commonly known as the Koyae mountain mallow, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Philippines. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers with prominent stamens, and its hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
